text:
Here is a bug that was alredy reported on php.net and it seem to be an apache 
2 problem with the char-set-handling (see added URL)

The output on the screen was:
Server error!
Error message: 
couldn't create child process: 22: C:/php4/php.exe 
If you think this is a server error, please contact the webmaster 
Error 500
server 
04/16/02 19:13:40 
Apache/2.0.36 (Win32)

It happens when trying to use  Norwegian letters (ÆØÅ and æøå), that are used 
in languages as Hebrew and others. on Apache 1.3.24 with same php version 
there was no problem.

What I ment on "when trying to use Norwegian letters" is that it happens when 
I send variables and values with those letters in get method (or in the URL).
When I use post it worked fine.
creator: galtalmor@gmail.com
galtalmor@gmail.com
text:
And another thing I discovered now, if I use the DLL modul of PHP (comes in 
php version 4.2.1) it worked fine, no problem!
It means that this problem has something with the CGI version (or whatever) of 
PHP particularly, and with CGI generally.

Because the WinNT Apache process attempts to track all text strings as utf-8
  (transposing them directly into WinNT Unicode arguments) QUERY_STRING and
  other user-provided strings are also treated as utf-8.

  This needs research and a flexible solution, tracking the issue under Bug 9223.

*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of 9223 ***
